Alternate.assistance: We recommend visiting <0>https://dphhs.mt.gov/Assistance</0> to learn about other assistance in Montana.
Alternate.location: If you are not currently living or working in Montana, visit <0>SignUpWIC.com</0> to find a clinic near you.
Alternate.subHeader: Given your responses, you are likely not eligible for WIC.
Alternate.title: Your eligibility

Clinic.body: Youâ€™ll need to visit a clinic in person to complete a certification appointment for WIC. Choose the clinic you would like to go to during business hours.
Clinic.listTitle: Choose a clinic from the following list:
Clinic.searchLabel: Enter your residential ZIP code to search for a clinic
Clinic.title: Choose a clinic
Clinic.zipSearchError: Sorry, we could not find a match for this ZIP code in Montana. Please check what you entered and try again.
Clinic.zipValidationError: Please enter 5 digits for the ZIP code.

Contact.name: What's your name?
Contact.other: Is there anything else you'd like to share with us?
Contact.phone: What's the best phone number to reach you at?
Contact.phoneAlert: Your chosen WIC clinic will contact you via phone to set up a time for a certification appointment during business hours.
Contact.title: Contact information

Eligibility.accordionBody: There are multiple categories of eligibility, and your answers here help us understand what benefits you and/or your family may qualify for.
Eligibility.baby: I've had a baby in the past 12 months
Eligibility.categorical: Please select all the following that apply to your family:
Eligibility.child: I'm the parent of an infant or child under the age of 5 years old
Eligibility.guardian: I'm the guardian or foster parent of an infant or child under the age of 5 years old
Eligibility.loss: I have had a pregnancy end in the last 6 months
Eligibility.programs: Are you currently enrolled in any of the following programs?
Eligibility.residential: Do you live or work in Montana?

Income.accordionBody:
A household is defined as all persons, related or unrelated, living together in the same dwelling and sharing financial resources and costs, with the exception of foster children.
If someone in your household is pregnant and applying for WIC benefits and is determined to be ineligible based on your household income, you may then increase your household size by the number of expected births.
Income.enrolled: If you are currently enrolled in Medicaid, Healthy Montana Kids Plus, Healthy Montana Kids Plus, Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF), or Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations (FDPIR), you may be automatically eligible for WIC.
Income.estimatedIncome: Estimated maximum income limit before taxes
Income.helper: If someone in your household is pregnant and applying for WIC benefits and is determined to be ineligible based on your household income, you may then increase your household size by the number of expected births.
Income.notEnrolled: If you are not currently enrolled in one or more of those programs, you will have to show proof your income is within a certain level.
Income.title: To be eligible for WIC, your household income before taxes must be at or below a certain income level.
Income.unsure: If you are unsure about your income, please continue to apply. A WIC staff member can answer more specific questions about your situation.

Index.benefits: There are many benefits including healthy food, breastfeeding support, nutrition education, and connections to local resources.
Index.header: WIC (Women, Infants, and Children) is a program designed to help families and young children during an important time in growth and development.
Index.supplement: WIC is meant to supplement your food budget and complement your use of other resources.
Index.time: You can start the application process for WIC now. This form should take about 10 minutes to complete.
Index.title: Start an application for WIC
Index.voluntary: WIC is a voluntary program and participation will not interfere with use of other programs like SNAP or Medicaid.

Information.apply: You can start applying for WIC by checking to see if you're eligible.
Information.appointment: During your appointment, you'll need to show documentation of your income, indentity, and residence.
Information.appointmentHeader: Attend your appointment at your local WIC clinic
Information.eligible: If you are eligible, a staff member from your local WIC office will call you for additional information and to set up a certification appointment.
Information.note: Note: this form does not guarantee enrollment in WIC, your eligibility will be confirmed when you have your first appointment with WIC.
Information.title: How it works

Layout.footer1: This site is a demonstration project built with <0>Montana WIC</0> and is for example purposes only. If you need to submit an application for WIC, please use <1>SignUpWIC.com</1> to find a location near you.
Layout.footer2: <0>USDA Non-Discrimination Statement</0>: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

Review.clinicSelected: You selected this WIC Clinic to visit
Review.subHeader: Review the information on this page before submitting. If you want to make changes, select "Edit" to go to the section you want to change.
Review.title: Review and submit your information

Summary.body: Thank you for submitting your information. If you're eligible, you should hear from WIC staff at your chosen clinic within 20 days.
Summary.title: Your confirmation

asterisk: All required questions are marked with an asterisk
